description:
《英文天天写》是沪江社团一档写作类社刊，其目的在于提升大家的英语写作能力。每期节目主持人都会给出一个话题，积极参加的童鞋还会得到主持人的专业点评哦！想提高英语写作的童鞋千万不要错过哦！去沪江社团订阅本社刊！

              

话题：

Writing: imagine a scenario or express your opinion
Around
Around means being in a circle. What is going around? Why does it happen? What will be the outcome?
This week's topic: They went around... (90-110 words)

Suggestions:
1) gather around
2) turn around at the deadend
3) rumors going around
4) getting around an obstacle
5) Instead of writing a scenario, feel free to comment on the story below.

范例1：

After finishing their meal, the interior stayed only for a short time to talk to the club manager before taking his leave. Seeing the club was getting busier by the minute as the hour became late, the designer was aware that the manager probably needed to make his rounds and kept his eyes on his place of business. The interior designer formally thanked his host and left the club. When he got outside, he turned around and looked at the place. Customers were keen to get in, and soon enough, there would be a line outside.   After finishing their meal, the interior stayed only for a short time to talk to the club manager before taking his leave. Seeing the club was getting busier by the minute as the hour became late, the designer was aware that the manager probably needed to make his rounds and kept his eyes on his place of business. The interior designer formally thanked his host and left the club. When he got outside, he turned around and looked at the place. Customers were keen to get in, and soon enough, there would be a line outside.   

想要得到专业主持人的点评和意见吗？快来节目现场一试身手吧>>

title: 英文天天写：Around

description:
Later today, America's central bank, the Federal Reserve, is expected to raise interest rates for the first time since 2006. That will make it more expensive to borrow for many the world over. In effect, it puts an end to our era of low and zero interest rates. In a moment, more on the global repercussions of that. But first, for many people working in financial markets, a rate increase is a completely foreign concept. A good proportion have seen nothing but near zero interest rates during their careers so far. And in the business world, there will be both winners and losers. The BBC's Michelle Fleury reports from New York.

The last time America's central bank raised interest rates, this Shakira song was number one, nearly a decade ago. To find out what the impact of a US interest rate rise might have on businesses, I've come to visit one exporter Royce here in New Jersey. They specialise in making accessories.

This is a Moleskine they call us. These are embossing six pieces.

Embossing a logo on a leather notebook, Royce Leather just outside New York makes wallets, notebooks and a host of other products. Half of them are sold in countries around the world, including Canada, India and Australia.
